title: Kevin Durant, Rockets pummel exhausted Celtics to snap three-game winning streak: 6 takeaways
author: Tom Westerholm
bullets: Celtics' three-game win streak ended with a 128-101 loss to the Rockets in Boston.
Kevin Durant scored 26 points, leading the Rockets, who made 65.5% of their 3-pointers.
Baylor Scheierman led the Celtics with 17 points, shooting 6-for-7 overall and 4-for-5 from deep.

title: Patriots elevate veteran RB D’Ernest Johnson ahead of Sunday’s game vs. Falcons
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Patriots elevate veteran RB D'Ernest Johnson from practice squad for Sunday's game against the Falcons.
Johnson could debut with the Patriots as Rhamondre Stevenson is out due to a toe injury.
Johnson has NFL experience with Browns, Jaguars, and Cardinals, including 671 scrimmage yards in 2021.

title: A new partnership between McAvoy, Zadorov has Bruins defense regaining some bite
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Charlie McAvoy and Nikita Zadorov form a new successful defensive pairing for the Bruins.
The Bruins have improved defensively, winning their last three games after a poor start to the season.
The Zadorov-McAvoy pairing allowed only one 5-on-5 goal in over 73 minutes of ice time this season.

title: How Jeremy Swayman responded after tweak in Bruins goalie rotation
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Jeremy Swayman excelled in the Bruins' 2-1 win over Carolina, saving 27 of 28 shots.
Joonas Korpisalo started consecutive games for Boston following Swayman's 7-2 loss against Ottawa.
Coach Marco Sturm values competition between Swayman and Korpisalo for a more balanced goalie rotation.

title: 9 things to know about Red Sox’ situation entering MLB offseason
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Red Sox enter the offseason with flexibility to spend before hitting the luxury tax, overseen by chief baseball officer Craig Breslow.
Free agents include players like Rob Refsnyder and Dustin May, with Alex Bregman expected to opt out of his contract.
Trade targets may include pitchers like Joe Ryan and potential free agent Kyle Tucker is linked to the Red Sox.

title: CBS’s Jason McCourty has seen a lot of the Patriots this season, and even he didn’t see this level of success coming
author: Chad Finn
bullets: Jason McCourty to call Patriots vs. Falcons game, his third Patriots game this regular season.
McCourty noted Patriots' improvement due to Drake Maye's strong performances and Mike Vrabel's coaching.
Patriots achieved a 6-2 record, surprising McCourty with Maye as an MVP candidate.

title: Patriots reportedly targeting Dolphins pass rusher ahead of trade deadline
author: Conor Roche
bullets: The New England Patriots are reportedly interested in trading for Miami Dolphins edge rusher Jaelan Phillips.
Phillips, 26, has logged three sacks this season and is in the final year of his rookie contract.
Dolphins are asking for at least a third-round pick for Phillips, with interest also from 49ers and Eagles.

title: Marco Sturm: Bruins’ Mason Lohrei should be angry after getting scratched again
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Mason Lohrei scratched for the third consecutive Boston Bruins game, sidelined since Hampus Lindholm's return.
Coach Marco Sturm urges Lohrei to use his benching as a learning opportunity to improve defensive play.
Nikita Zadorov replaces Lohrei, stabilizing the Bruins' defense alongside Charlie McAvoy with improved performance.

title: 5 things to know about Falcons before Sunday’s game vs. Patriots
author: Conor Roche
bullets: The Falcons have a 3-4 record and are seeking to spark a playoff run against the Patriots.
Quarterback Michael Penix has struggled in outdoor stadiums, with a 65.5 passer rating in three outdoor starts.
Running back Bijan Robinson leads the NFL in scrimmage yards per game and poses a dual threat as a receiver.

title: Pair of former Red Sox save Dodgers to force Game 7 of World Series
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Mookie Betts and Kiké Hernandez led the Dodgers to a 3-1 win over the Blue Jays in Game 6.
Betts broke his World Series slump with a two-run single, giving the Dodgers a 3-0 lead in the third inning.
Hernandez made a crucial defensive play, throwing out a runner to end the game and force a Game 7.
